H0.text: Stormy weather can be expected if a center of low pressure is moving your way.

H1.text: Rain is the kind of weather you can expect when a center of low pressure is moving your way.

H2.text: Rough weather can be expected when a center of low pressure is moving your way.

H3.text: Sunny is the kind of weather you can expect if a center of low pressure is moving your way.

A4.text: Low-pressure areas are commonly associated with inclement weather (such as cloudy, windy, with possible rain or storms).

A5.text: The stronger the pressure difference between a high-pressure system and a low-pressure system, the stronger the wind.

A6.text: Cold fronts often bring rain, and sometimes heavy thunderstorms as well.

A7.text: Low pressure also creates surface winds deriving from high pressure zones and vice versa.

A8.text: A tropical cyclone is a storm system with a closed circulation around a centre of low pressure.

A9.text: A rapid deepening of a mid-latitude cyclonic low-pressure area is a bomb cyclone.
